pullrequest.title: [NEW] [DOCS] Add line integral convolution for plot modification callback

content.raw: I think it might be better to use the geometry-specific pixelizers so this will work for curvilinear coordinate systems. @MatthewTurk likely knows better than I do whether that will be necessary.
content.html: I think it might be better to use the geometry-specific pixelizers so this will work for curvilinear coordinate systems. Matt Turk likely knows better than I do whether that will be necessary.

pullrequest.title: [NEW] [DOCS] Add line integral convolution for plot modification callback

content.raw: Thanks for your suggestion! I've also tested FLASH 2D cylindrical data. Is there a special geometry that will lead to the failure of this callback?
content.html: Thanks for your suggestion! I've also tested FLASH 2D cylindrical data. Is there a special geometry that will lead to the failure of this callback?

pullrequest.title: [NEW] [DOCS] Add line integral convolution for plot modification callback

content.raw: The interface to the new pixelization machinery is `ds.coordinates.pixelize`, which right now is "only" used in the `FixedResolutionBuffer` base class to make it agnostic to the underlying coordinate system of a given dataset.  Like I said earlier, I'm not sure whether it's necessary here.
content.html: The interface to the new pixelization machinery is ds.coordinates.pixelize, which right now is "only" used in the FixedResolutionBuffer base class to make it agnostic to the underlying coordinate system of a given dataset. Like I said earlier, I'm not sure whether it's necessary here.

pullrequest.title: [NEW] [DOCS] Add line integral convolution for plot modification callback

content.raw:
So I just asked Matt and he says that using `ds.coordinates.pixelize` is the way to go.

The other instances in this file should probably be updated, but I think it would be better to do that in a separate pull request so we can have better review without hiding the change inside this one.
content.html:
So I just asked Matt and he says that using ds.coordinates.pixelize is the way to go.

The other instances in this file should probably be updated, but I think it would be better to do that in a separate pull request so we can have better review without hiding the change inside this one.

content.raw:
if I understand this correctly, it's flipping the 0 and 1 axes?  If so, it might be a bit terser to do:

```
vectors = vectors[:,::-1].copy()
```
content.html:
if I understand this correctly, it's flipping the 0 and 1 axes? If so, it might be a bit terser to do:

vectors = vectors[:,::-1].copy()

pullrequest.title: [NEW] [DOCS] Add line integral convolution for plot modification callback

description:
Test script and output image:


```
#!python

import yt
ds = yt.load("IsolatedGalaxy/galaxy0030/galaxy0030")
s = yt.SlicePlot(ds, 'z', 'density', center='c', width=(20, 'kpc'))
s.annotate_line_integral_convolution('velocity_x', 'velocity_y', lim=(0.5,0.65))
s.save()
```

![galaxy0030_Slice_z_density.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/BXbAb/images/710431269-galaxy0030_Slice_z_density.png)
